# Kubernetes Networking

## Overview

Kubernetes networking addresses four concerns:

1. Containers within a Pod use networking to communicate via loopback
2. Cluster networking provides communication between different Pods
3. The Service API lets you expose an application running in Pods
4. You can use Ingress to expose your application to external users

## Pod Networking

Every Pod gets its own IP address. This means you don't need to explicitly create links between Pods.

## Service Types

- ClusterIP: Exposes the service on a cluster-internal IP
- NodePort: Exposes the service on each Node's IP at a static port
- LoadBalancer: Exposes the service externally using a cloud provider's load balancer

## References

- https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/
